techmeme.title: Adobe says its Firefly Video Model is the first "commercially safe" text-to-video generative AI model that was trained on licensed and public domain content (Jeremy Gray/PetaPixel)
Q&A with Duolingo co-founder and CEO Luis von Ahn on gamifying language learning, how the app makes money, investing in AI, founder mode, return to office, more (Nilay Patel/The Verge)
Google signs an agreement to purchase nuclear energy generated from multiple small modular reactors developed by Kairos Power, targeting 500 MW by 2035 (Jennifer Hiller/Wall Street Journal)
Sources: Microsoft lost billions of dollars on HoloLens before discontinuing it and is pulling back work on IVAS, the combat goggles for the US Army (Ashley Stewart/Business Insider)
Sebastien Bubeck, Microsoft's VP of GenAI research who is known for his work on Microsoft's Phi small language models, is leaving the company to join OpenAI (Juby Babu/Reuters)
